column1: #Text=The party is hoping to garner enough votes in the September election to become a small but important faction in the next Swedish parliament .
#Text=Rickard Falkvinge found some time in between interviews and party work to answer our questions .
#Text=There are rumours that the Swedish government was indirectly acting on behalf of the U.S. MPAA in shutting down the site .
#Text=Do you feel that your government is beholden to U.S. interests ?
#Text=Oh , the MPAA said so themselves in a press release , it 's more than a rumor .
#Text=Check their press release " Swedish authorities sink Pirate Bay " . [ Ed . : see below ]
#Text=And yes , this particular fact has caused something of an uproar in Sweden .

#Text=It 's widely believed that Swedish authorities were more or less ordered by a foreign power to act forcefully against an entity that was in , at worst , a legal gray area according to Swedish law .
#Text=The raid must have boosted your recognition .
#Text=How many members do you currently have , and how successful has your fundraising effort been so far ?
#Text=Our member count is at 6540 , no , 6541 , no wait , 6543 ... well , you get the picture .
#Text=Our members register themselves on our website after paying the membership fee electronically , which helps reduce our admin load considerably .
#Text=Fundraising brought in 108,000 SEK [ Ed . : approx. 14,700 USD or 11,600 EUR ] , enough to buy 3 million ballots , which is some kind of at-least-we're-not-starving minimum .
#Text=We 're not full , but we 're not starving , either .
#Text=Following the raid on the Pirate Bay , we have received another 50K in donations .

#Text=My sincere thanks to everybody who wants to help out ; we are now looking into getting more ballots to make sure we do n't run out on election day . ( 10 million ballots was our initial full-score aim . )
